page.title: 15EDUCATION
page.content: EDINGTON COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL HISTORY - The school was built in 1877 taking the place of 6 small Dame Schools in the village.It was purchased for Â£490 (including grounds) by the parish to abide by the 1870 Educatoin act, which required provision for education all children.A headteachers 3 bedroomed house was attached. Originally designed for 120 pupils, it has never had more than 100, although during the 2nd World War a number of evacuees brought the total to 96. The building has changed very little since its opening, there still being 2 classrooms,2 cloakrooms, and outside toilets in a separate block. The house is now unoccupied and serves as a store with one room being the school office. Together with a small field on site, the school has the use of a large playfield 100m away.
